post.summary: Update user status in the FireCloud Free Credits Program; for managers of the Program only.
post.description:
* **Enable** Add registered user(s) to FireCloud's internal record of users that are allowed to enroll (of their own accord, by clicking the Enroll button in the UI)
* **Disable** If a user has not yet enrolled themselves, we can still remove them from the trial. Reverse of the Enable operation.
* **Terminate** End the user's trial by removing their billing project from the FireCloud Free Credits Program billing account. The user will no longer be able to create workspaces in that billing project.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: operation to perform on the specified users.

parameters.name: users
parameters.description: list of users on which to operate

post.summary: Manage projects in the FireCloud Free Credits Program; for managers of the Program only.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description:
operation to perform on projects.
"Create" will create projects and verify those projects.
"Verify" will verify all unverified projects in the pool.
"Count" will return the number of projects in various statuses.
"Adopt" will enter a previously-created project into the pool without verifying it.
"Scratch" will mark a pool project as unavailable/errored and disassociate it from any user that claimed it.
"Report" will return a report of all claimed projects.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: number of projects to create; only used for create operation

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: name of project to adopt or scratch; only used for adopt and scratch operations

400.description: Bad Request. Creation already in progress or incorrect credentials.

403.description: You must be a campaign manager to call this endpoint.

post.summary: Update a method configuration in a workspace
post.description:
Update method configuration.
Updates and moves the method configuration at the URI to the location in the request body.
The location in the URI may be the same as the location in the request body.
If the location in the request body matches the location in the URI, it is overwritten.
If the location in the request body is different to the location in the URI, and there is a method config already at that location, 409 is returned.

get.summary: List method configurations in a workspace
get.description:
List method configurations in a workspace. By default, only Agora method configs are returned. To return configs for all repos, specify `allRepos` to be `true`.

#### Expanded discussion on the methodRepoMethod field

This endpoint returns method references to Agora in the format
```
"methodRepoMethod": {
  "methodNamespace": "namespace",
  "methodName": "name",
  "methodVersion": 1,
  "sourceRepo": "agora",
  "methodUri": "agora://namespace/name/1"
}
```
and for Dockstore in the format
```
"methodRepoMethod": {
  "methodPath": "path",
  "methodVersion": "version",
  "sourceRepo": "agora",
  "methodUri": "dockstore://path/version"
}
```
If you are only working with Agora methods, the fields `"sourceRepo"` and `"methodUri"` can be considered informational and do not need to be round-tripped (see the corresponding `POST /api/workspaces/{workspaceNamespace}/{workspaceName}/methodconfigs` for more details).

parameters.name: allRepos
parameters.description: Configs for all repos, not just Agora

post.summary: Create a Method Configuration in a workspace
post.description:
Create method configurations.
#### Expanded discussion on the methodRepoMethod field
To create a method config for an Agora method, `"sourceRepo": "agora"` is optional; the following is sufficient:
```
"methodRepoMethod": {
  "methodNamespace": "namespace",
  "methodName": "name",
  "methodVersion": 1
}
```
To create a method config for a Dockstore method, `"sourceRepo": "dockstore"` is required:
```
"methodRepoMethod": {
  "sourceRepo": "dockstore",
  "methodPath": "path",
  "methodVersion": "version"
}
```
You may also use the URI on its own to create a config referencing any supported repo (currently Agora and Dockstore):
```
"methodRepoMethod": {
  "methodUri": "agora://namespace/name/1"
}
```
```
"methodRepoMethod": {
  "methodUri": "dockstore://path/version"
}
```
The system is specified to check for a URI first before falling back to the legacy fields. Unsupported repos will return a 400 Bad Request.

lastUpdate.description: Date of the last update in date-time milliseconds

sortDate.description: The lastest modification date in date-time milliseconds

requiresManualReview.description: Describes if this consent has to be reviewed manually.

dataUseLetter.description: The URL of the saved file.

useRestriction.description: The UseRestriction of this consent. Used to match against another entities.

dulName.description: Name that identifies the Data Use Letter file.

translatedUseRestriction.description: The translated use restriction of the consent.

generalResearchUse.description: Is the data available for future general research use?

healthMedicalBiomedicalUseRequired.description: Is future use limited for health/medical/biomedical research?

diseaseUseRequired.description: Future use is limited to research involving the following disease area(s). These values must be urls such as "http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/DOID_12345".

forProfitUseProhibited.description: Is future use by for-profit entities prohibited?

methodsResearchProhibited.description: Is future use for methods research (analytic/software/technology development) outside the bounds of the other specified restrictions prohibited?

aggregateLevelDataProhibited.description: Is future use of aggregate-level data for general research purposes prohibited?

controlsUseProhibited.description: Is future use as a control set for diseases other than those specified prohibited?

genderUseRequired.description: If future use is limited to research involving a particular gender, specify "male" or "female". Any other value will be read as false. This field is case-insensitive.

pediatricResearchRequired.description: Is future use limited to pediatric research?

irbRequired.description: Should the requester provide documentation of local IRB/REC approval?

prefix.description: Optional. A prefix that is prepended to the field names of the responses. This is purely for personalization.

entityNames.description: List of entity names to be copied

projectName.description: the name of the project to create

billingAccount.description: the id of the billing account to use, must start with 'billingAccounts/'

name.description: the name of the NIH dataset

authorized.description: true if you have access to the dataset, false otherwise

allUsersGroup.description: User is a member of the "All Users" group?

referencedBy.description: workspace configuration that references the method

acls.description: method repo ACLs for the referenced method

message.description: error message generated when retrieving acls for this method

entitiesCopied.description: the entities that were successfully copied into the workspace

hardConflicts.description: these entities already exist in your workspace

softConflicts.description: the conflicts within your entity subtrees. note that this will be empty if there are hard conflicts

pageSize.description: count of items per page, positive integer

filteredPageCount.description: count of pages after filtering; honors pageSize parameter

conflicts.description: the next entity in the path to the conflict

totalCount.description: the number of published workspaces sent to be indexed

hasFailures.description: did the indexing operation result in any failures?

LibraryMetadataInput.description: JSON-standard packet of metadata as defined by the Library schema
LibraryMetadataInput.example:
{
  "library:requiresExternalApproval": false,
  "library:contactEmail": "someone@broadinstitute.org",
  "library:datasetName": "My Dataset",
  "library:numSubjects": 123,
  "library:datatype": ["Whole Exome", "Whole Genome"]
  ...
  additional JSON-standard fields as
  defined by the Library schema
  ...
}

ManagedGroupRef.description: a reference to a group that can be managed by users

groupName.description: The name of the Group with instructions

instructions.description: The instructions for applying to the Group

ManagedGroupAccessResponse.description: an element of a list of groups a user has access to

ManagedGroupWithMembers.description: a group with all of its members

message.description: ignored during input; if present during output, contains error messages

workspaceName.description: Map[String, String] with corresponding workspace-related information - name and namespace

name.description: The name of the method configuration

rootEntityType.description: The root entity type that the method will be running on. Optional if this method config doesn't run on an entity (i.e. uses only workspace attributes and literal inputs).

methodRepoMethod.description: The properties of the method from the method store that this config is associated with

deleted.description: Is this config marked as deleted?

name.description: The name of the method configuration

numConfigurations.description: count of configurations associated with this method

numSnapshots.description: count of snapshots of this method

documentation.default:
BWA is a software package for mapping low-divergent sequences
against a large reference genome, such as the human genome.
It consists of three algorithms: BWA-backtrack, BWA-SW and BWA-MEM.

payload.description: Payload of method -- must be in WDL format
payload.default: task wc {File in_file command { cat ${in_file} | wc -l } output { Int count = read_int(stdout()) }}

entityType.description: Type of the AgoraEntity -- Task or Workflow.

public.description: If this AgoraEntity is publicly readable.

methodNamespace.description: The namespace of the method in Agora

methodName.description: The name of the method in Agora

methodVersion.description: The integer method version in Agora (or a string method version for Dockstore)

methodPath.description: The path of the method in Dockstore

sourceRepo.description: The method's repository, currently one of "agora" or "dockstore"

methodUri.description: URI that specifies the method's repository and captures all the information necessary to identify the method within its repository (e.g. agora://namespace/name/1, dockstore://path/version)

documentation.description: Documentation of the AgoraEntity. MUST BE REQUESTED EXPLICITLY.
documentation.default:
BWA is a software package for mapping low-divergent sequences
against a large reference genome, such as the human genome.
It consists of three algorithms: BWA-backtrack, BWA-SW and BWA-MEM.

url.description: URL where resource can be accessed.

payload.description: Payload of method -- must be in WDL format. MUST BE REQUESTED EXPLICITLY.
payload.default: task wc {File in_file command { cat ${in_file} | wc -l } output { Int count = read_int(stdout()) }}

entityType.description: Type of the AgoraEntity -- Task or Workflow.

deleted.description: Is this config marked as deleted?

NotificationType.description: key and description of a notification

workspaceACL.description: a map of (user email -> WorkspaceAccessEntry). `exampleEmail` is an example key.

PermissionReport.description: ACLs for users of a workspace and methods referenced by that workspace

users.description: list of email addresses; optional; defaults to all users in the workspace

configs.description: list of configs; optional; defaults to all configs in the workspace

PermissionReportRequest.description: users and/or configs on which to report.

contactEmail.description: User's contact email (if different from account email)

groupEmail.description: the email associated with the group

DS.description: Disease focused research. Values are DOID ontology node ids in the form http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/DOID_NNN. Specify an empty array if this is not disease focused research.

NAGR.description: Aggregate analysis to understand variation in the general population

DS.description: Disease focused research. Values are DOID ontology node ids in the form http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/DOID_NNN. Specify an empty array if this is not disease focused research.

NAGR.description: Aggregate analysis to understand variation in the general population

prefix.description: Prefix for query properties. Must match prefix used when indexing.

filters.description: Map[String, Array[String]] Each entry contains the column name (i.e. "library:indication") and a list of terms that will be or'ed in the query (["cancer", "sleep apnea"])

fieldAggregations.description: Map[String, Int] The list of fields for which you would like to retrieve aggregations and the number of aggregations to return. Default is 5. Specify 0 to get all

from.description: Where in the results list to start (used for pagination)

sortField.description: Field name on which to sort; defaults to sort by relevance if not specified

sortDirection.description: asc or desc; defaults to asc if not specified

submissionEntity.description: Optional if this submission is attached to a method configuration that has no root entity

cost.description: The compute cost of this submission

useCallCache.description: Whether or not to read from cache for this submission

workflowFailureMode.description: What happens after a task fails. Choose from ContinueWhilePossible and NoNewCalls. Defaults to NoNewCalls if not specified. See Cromwell docs for more information.

methodConfigurationNamespace.description: Namespace of the method configuration to execute.

methodConfigurationName.description: Name of the method configuration to execute.

entityType.description: Type of root entity for expression. Optional if the method configuration has no root entity.

entityName.description: Name of root entity for expression. Optional if the method configuration has no root entity.

expression.description: Expression that resolves to one or more entities matching the entity type in the method configuration. Optional if the method configuration has no root entity.

useCallCache.description: Whether or not to read from cache for this submission.

workflowFailureMode.description: What happens after a task fails. Choose from ContinueWhilePossible and NoNewCalls. Defaults to NoNewCalls if not specified. See Cromwell docs for more information.

SubmissionRequest.description: If the referenced method configuration takes no root entity, do not define `entityType`, `entityName` and `expression`.

SubmissionValidationEntityInputs.description: the results of parsing each of the inputs for one entity

SubmissionValidationHeader.description: common values for all the entities -- the entity type and the input descriptions

SubmissionValidationInput.description: method configuration input parameter, it's name and the associated expression from the method config

SubmissionValidationReport.description: the results of parsing each input for each entity

SystemStatus.description: report status of systems Orchestration calls out to

value.description: the value of the input expression for the specified entity

SubmissionValidationValue.description: result of an expression parse for one of the inputs

id.description: The unique identifier for the class

name.description: A short friendly name for the class

description.description: A longer explanation of what this class is and what it can accomplish

ToolClass.description: Describes a class (type) of tool allowing us to categorize workflows, tools, and maybe even other entities (such as services) separately

url.description: The URL for this tool in this registry, for example `http://agora.broadinstitute.org/tools/123456`

id.description: A unique identifier of the tool, scoped to this registry, for example `123456` or `123456_v1`

organization.description: The organization that published the image.

author.description: Contact information for the author of this tool entry in the registry. (More complex authorship information is handled by the descriptor)

meta-version.description: The version of this tool in the registry. Iterates when fields like the description, author, etc. are updated.

contains.description: An array of IDs for the applications that are stored inside this tool (for example `https://bio.tools/tool/mytum.de/SNAP2/1`). This always returns an empty array.

verified.description: Reports whether this tool has been verified by a specific organization or individual.  This always returns false.

verified-source.description: Source of metadata that can support a verified tool, such as an email or URL

signed.description: Reports whether this tool has been signed.  This always returns false.

versions.description: A list of versions for this tool

Tool.description: A tool (or described tool) describes one pairing of a tool as described in a descriptor file (which potentially describes multiple tools) and a Docker image.

url.description: The URL for this tool in this registry, for example `http://agora.broadinstitute.org/tools/123456/1`

id.description: An identifier of the version of this tool for this particular tool registry, for example `v1`

image.description: The docker path to the image (and version) for this tool. (e.g. quay.io/seqware/seqware_full/1.1). This always returns an empty string.

descriptor-type.description: The type (or types) of descriptors available.

dockerfile.description: Reports if this tool has a dockerfile available. This always returns false.

meta-version.description: The version of this tool version in the registry. Iterates when fields like the description, author, etc. are updated.

ToolVersion.description: A tool version describes a particular iteration of a tool as described by a reference to a specific image and dockerfile.

descriptor.description: The descriptor that represents this version of the tool. (WDL)

url.description: Optional url to the tool descriptor used to build this image, should include version information, and can include a git hash (e.g. https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ICGC-TCGA-PanCancer/pcawg_delly_workflow/ea2a5db69bd20a42976838790bc29294df3af02b/delly_docker/Delly.cwl )

ToolDescriptor.description: A tool descriptor is a metadata document that describes one or more tools.

TrialOperationResponse.description: The result of the operation for each user, grouped by the status

api-version.description: The version of the GA4GH tool-registry API supported by this registry

country.description: A country code for the registry (ISO 3166-1 alpha-3)

friendly-name.description: A friendly name that can be used in addition to the hostname to describe a registry

Metadata.description: Describes this registry to better allow for mirroring and indexing.

billingProject.description: does the user have at least one ready billing project?

writableWorkspace.description: does the user have at least one writable workspace?

ValidatedMethodConfiguration.description: Information about the validity of a method configuration's expressions relative to the method itself

workflowEntity.description: Optional if this workflow did not run on an entity (i.e. its method configuration has no root entity)

messages.description: List of messages about this workflow

cost.description: The run cost of this workflow

WorkflowCost.description: The cost of a workflow, if available

estimatedQueueTimeMS.description: estimated milliseconds until the current queue is submitted

workflowsBeforeNextUserWorkflow.description: the number of workflows in the queue ahead of the user's first workflow

WorkflowQueueStatusResponse.description: Information about the status of workflows and the workflow queue

namespace.description: The namespace the workspace belongs to

authorizationDomain.description: The list of groups to form the Authorization Domain (empty if no Authorization Domain is set)

workspaceId.description: A UUID associated with the workspace

bucketName.description: The name of the bucket associated with the workspace

createdDate.description: The date the workspace was created in yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZZ format

lastModified.description: The date the workspace was last modified in yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZZ format

createdBy.description: The user who created the workspace

isLocked.description: Can the Workspace currently be modified?

email.description: email address of the user or group whose permissions will be changed

accessLevel.description: The access level to grant to this user or group (OWNER, READER, WRITER, NO ACCESS)

canShare.description: Set to true if you want this user to be able to share the workspace with other users, only meaningful for readers and writers, default false

canCompute.description: Set to true if you want this user to be able to launch compute in this workspace, may not be true for readers, default false for reader, true otherwise

subjectId.description: id of the user or group whose permissions will be changed

accessLevel.description: The access level granted to this user or group (OWNER, READER, WRITER, NO ACCESS)

usersUpdated.description: the users or groups who were updated

invitesSent.description: the list of invites that were sent

invitesUpdated.description: the list of invites that were updated

usersNotFound.description: the users or groups who were not found

accessLevel.description: The access level granted to this user or group (OWNER, READER, WRITER, NO ACCESS)

pending.description: The status of the users access

canShare.description: True if the user can share the workspace with others, false otherwise

canCompute.description: True if the user can launch compute in this workspace, false otherwise

email.description: email address of the user or group whose permissions will be changed

catalog.description: Set to true if you want this user to be able to perform library related operations on the workspace

subjectId.description: subject id of the user or group whose permissions were changed

catalog.description: Set to true if you want this user to be able to perform library related operations on the workspace

usersUpdated.description: the users or groups who were updated

emailsNotFound.description: the emails of users or groups who were not found

authorizationDomain.description: The list of groups to form the Authorization Domain (empty if no Authorization Domain is set)

count.description: number of usages of the tag across Firecloud

outputs.description: Map[String, AttributeString] from method's WDL outputs to fields in the workspace data model

inputs.description: Map[String, AttributeString] from method's WDL inputs to fields in the workspace data model

against a large reference genome, such as the human genome.
